parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the campaign to retrieve information about.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the campaign.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the campaign.

nested_items.name: signalCatalogArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a signal catalog.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the vehicle or the fleet targeted by the campaign.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The state of the campaign. The status can be one of: CREATING, WAITING_FOR_APPROVAL, RUNNING, and SUSPENDED.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, to deliver a campaign after it was approved.

nested_items.name: expiryTime
nested_items.description: The time the campaign expires, in seconds since epoch (January 1, 1970 at midnight UTC time). Vehicle data won't be collected after the campaign expires.

nested_items.name: postTriggerCollectionDuration
nested_items.description: How long (in seconds) to collect raw data after a triggering event initiates the collection.

nested_items.name: diagnosticsMode
nested_items.description: Option for a vehicle to send diagnostic trouble codes to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise.

nested_items.name: spoolingMode
nested_items.description: Whether to store collected data after a vehicle lost a connection with the cloud. After a connection is re-established, the data is automatically forwarded to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise.

nested_items.name: compression
nested_items.description: Whether to compress signals before transmitting data to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise. If OFF is specified, the signals aren't compressed. If it's not specified, SNAPPY is used.

nested_items.name: priority
nested_items.description: A number indicating the priority of one campaign over another campaign for a certain vehicle or fleet. A campaign with the lowest value is deployed to vehicles before any other campaigns.

nested_items.name: signalsToCollect
nested_items.description: Information about a list of signals to collect data on.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the signal.

nested_items.name: maxSampleCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of samples to collect.

nested_items.name: minimumSamplingIntervalMs
nested_items.description: The minimum duration of time (in milliseconds) between two triggering events to collect data.

nested_items.name: dataPartitionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the data partition this signal is associated with.

nested_items.name: collectionScheme
nested_items.description: Information about the data collection scheme associated with the campaign.

nested_items.name: timeBasedCollectionScheme
nested_items.description: Information about a collection scheme that uses a time period to decide how often to collect data.

nested_items.name: periodMs
nested_items.description: The time period (in milliseconds) to decide how often to collect data. For example, if the time period is 60000, the Edge Agent software collects data once every minute.

nested_items.name: conditionBasedCollectionScheme
nested_items.description: Information about a collection scheme that uses a simple logical expression to recognize what data to collect.

nested_items.name: expression
nested_items.description: The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0.

nested_items.name: minimumTriggerIntervalMs
nested_items.description: The minimum duration of time between two triggering events to collect data, in milliseconds.

nested_items.name: triggerMode
nested_items.description: Whether to collect data for all triggering events ( ALWAYS). Specify ( RISING_EDGE), or specify only when the condition first evaluates to false. For example, triggering on 'AirbagDeployed'; Users aren't interested on triggering when the airbag is already exploded; they only care about the change from not deployed => deployed.

nested_items.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies the version of the conditional expression language.

nested_items.name: dataExtraDimensions
nested_items.description: A list of vehicle attributes associated with the campaign.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the campaign was created in seconds since epoch (January 1, 1970 at midnight UTC time).

nested_items.name: lastModificationTime
nested_items.description: The last time the campaign was modified.

nested_items.name: dataDestinationConfigs
nested_items.description: The destination where the campaign sends data. You can send data to an MQTT topic, or store it in Amazon S3 or Amazon Timestream.

nested_items.name: bucketArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: dataFormat
nested_items.description: Specify the format that files are saved in the Amazon S3 bucket. You can save files in an Apache Parquet or JSON format.
Parquet - Store data in a columnar storage file format. Parquet is optimal for fast data retrieval and can reduce costs. This option is selected by default.
JSON - Store data in a standard text-based JSON file format.

nested_items.name: storageCompressionFormat
nested_items.description: By default, stored data is compressed as a .gzip file. Compressed files have a reduced file size, which can optimize the cost of data storage.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: Enter an S3 bucket prefix. The prefix is the string of characters after the bucket name and before the object name. You can use the prefix to organize data stored in Amazon S3 buckets. For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: timestreamConfig
nested_items.description: The Amazon Timestream table where the campaign sends data.

nested_items.name: timestreamTableArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Timestream table.

nested_items.name: executionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to deliver data to the Amazon Timestream table.

nested_items.name: mqttTopicConfig
nested_items.description: The MQTT topic to which the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise campaign routes data.

nested_items.name: mqttTopicArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: executionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to access and act on messages sent to the MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: dataPartitions
nested_items.description: The data partitions associated with the signals collected from the vehicle.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the data partition. The data partition ID must be unique within a campaign. You can establish a data partition as the default partition for a campaign by using default as the ID.

nested_items.name: storageOptions
nested_items.description: The storage options for a data partition.

nested_items.name: maximumSize
nested_items.description: The maximum storage size of the data stored in the data partition.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The data type of the data to store.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time to store data.

nested_items.name: storageLocation
nested_items.description: The folder name for the data partition under the campaign storage folder.

nested_items.name: minimumTimeToLive
nested_items.description: The amount of time that data in this partition will be kept on disk.
After the designated amount of time passes, the data can be removed, but it's not guaranteed to be removed.
Before the time expires, data in this partition can still be deleted if the partition reaches its configured maximum size.
Newer data will overwrite older data when the partition reaches the maximum size.

nested_items.name: uploadOptions
nested_items.description: The upload options for the data partition.

nested_items.name: expression
nested_items.description: The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0.

nested_items.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the condition language. Defaults to the most recent condition language version.

nested_items.name: signalsToFetch
nested_items.description: Information about a list of signals to fetch data from.

nested_items.name: fullyQualifiedName
nested_items.description: The fully qualified name of the signal to be fetched.

nested_items.name: signalFetchConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration of the signal fetch operation.

nested_items.name: timeBased
nested_items.description: The configuration of a time-based signal fetch operation.

nested_items.name: executionFrequencyMs
nested_items.description: The frequency with which the signal fetch will be executed.

nested_items.name: conditionBased
nested_items.description: The configuration of a condition-based signal fetch operation.

nested_items.name: conditionExpression
nested_items.description: The condition that must be satisfied to trigger a signal fetch.

nested_items.name: triggerMode
nested_items.description: Indicates the mode in which the signal fetch is triggered.

nested_items.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the condition language used.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions to be performed by the signal fetch.
(string) ---
